meanings.sent1: He recocked the toy gun before aiming.
meanings.sent2: After shooting, he recocked the rifle for the next shot.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy recocked his imaginary pistol for another showdown.
meanings.sent4: She recocked her determination to face the challenge head-on.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic recocked the engine, readying it for the race.

meanings.definition: To prepare or set again for use.
meanings.sent1: She recocked the trap to catch more mice.
meanings.sent2: The soldier recocked his weapon after cleaning it.
meanings.sent3: The chef recocked the ingredients for a second attempt at the recipe.
meanings.sent4: He recocked his resolve to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent5: The teacher recocked the lesson plan for the substitute teacher.
